title: Takeaways from every NFL Week 2 game: Eagles defeat Chiefs in Super Bowl rematch; Cowboys win in OT
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 2.

title: Debating Week 2 overreactions: We make sense of the Lions, Cowboys, Eagles, Chiefs
content: Do the Cowboys have playoff hopes? What's up with the Super Bowl duo? We sized up Week 2 overreactions.

title: Sources: Burrow could need surgery for turf toe
content: Cincinnati Bengals star quarterback Joe Burrow is dealing with a turf toe injury that could require surgery, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday night.

title: Eagles quiet Chiefs' talk with scoreboard statement
content: The Eagles got the final word during a hotly contested Super Bowl rematch with the Chiefs on Sunday that was intense to the very end.

title: McCarthy's second start a slog as Falcons soar
content: A week after authoring fourth-quarter heroics in a rousing Minnesota victory, Vikings quarterback J.J. McCarthy and the rest of the offense slogged through 60 mostly rough minutes in a 22-6 loss to the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday night at U.S. Bank Stadium.

title: Cowboys sign Clowney to boost depth, says Jones
content: The Cowboys have signed three-time Pro Bowl edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney to a contract, owner Jerry Jones said after the team's overtime win against the Giants on Sunday.

title: Aces open playoff run with 17th straight victory
content: On Sunday night at Michelob Ultra Arena, the Las Vegas Aces won their 17th consecutive game, opening their WNBA postseason run with a 102-77 decision over the Seattle Storm to move just one victory from tying the league record.

title: Reign-Racing game halted after DeMelo collapses
content: The Seattle Reign and Racing Louisville abandoned their match in the National Women's Soccer League on Sunday night after a medical emergency involving Racing midfielder Savannah DeMelo.

title: Raleigh makes more HR history; M's atop AL West
content: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh hit his 54th home run, tying Mickey Mantle's record for a switch-hitter and passing Javy Lopez's mark for catchers in a season (43).

title: Scheffler secures sixth win in Ryder Cup tuneup
content: Scottie Scheffler closed with a 5-under 67 to win the Procore Championship for his sixth PGA Tour victory of the year.

title: üèÜ Eagles' petty posts top Week 2 trolls
content: The San Francisco 49ers also made sure to poke fun at the New Orleans Saints after winning on the road, topping Week 2's NFL trolls.

title: Joe Burrow out with turf toe: What is it, and what would extended time away mean for the QB, Bengals?
content: Jake Browning helped deliver a win to the Bengals on Sunday, but what's reasonable to expect from the backup?

title: Your guide to Sunday's first-round WNBA playoff games
content: The Lynx, Aces, Dream and Liberty each lead their series 1-0. Here's how they did it, and how New York won in the desert.

title: WNBA playoff surprises: Why Dream, Mercury, more could crash the championship party
content: There's a clear three-team title race. Here's how the other five teams could make deeper runs than expected.

title: Late rally seals Kroger Queen City title for Charley Hull
content: Charley Hull, coming off a runner-up finish in Houston last week as part of the Aramco series on the European tour, took advantage of top-ranked Jeeno Thitikul's final-hole putting meltdown on Sunday to win the Kroger Queen City Championship in Ohio.

title: Ranking Week 2 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 2's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Fantasy Buzz: Bengals withstand Burrow injury, Lions offense roars
content: Jake Browning stepping in for an injured Joe Burrow and Mac Jones for Brock Purdy highlighted the early window.

title: Manchester derby reaction: How City beat United, Donnarumma and Haaland dazzle, more
content: Man City outclassed Man United in Sunday's derby, fully deserving their 3-0 win. Here's what you need to know from the fun at the Etihad.

title: Liverpool rely on late-game heroics to deliver another win
content: For the fourth straight game, Liverpool left it late for victory. Is that the sign of a Premier League champion?

title: Betting buzz: Derrick Henry stiff-arms betting public
content: It was a popular bet for Derrick Henry to score a touchdown on Sunday, but Baltimore's star RB failed to do so.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Is Carson Beck's stock trending back up at Miami?
content: Is Carson Beck rising in a wild QB class? Does Jordyn Tyson have challengers for WR1? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 3.

title: What is Aspiration, the company behind the Kawhi Leonard deal?
content: Here's what we know about now-defunct Aspiration, the company at the center of the salary cap circumvention accusations.

title: Jaedyn Shaw has supercharged Gotham FC
content: NJ/NY Gotham FC are rocketing up ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings thanks to the immediate impact of star recruit Jaedyn Shaw.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Barcelona track Palmeiras' Benedetti
content: Arsenal are ready to rival Barcelona for 19-year-old Palmeiras left-back Luiz Benedetti. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: üèà Ranking NFL QB debuts from Fields to Rodgers
content: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain their great Week 1 play? Ben Solak stacks the top QB newcomers -- and begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

title: ü§Ø Inside Rob Ryan's most surprising move yet
content: Even though Rob Ryan hasn't coached college football in over 25 years, he has already acclimated to life in L.A.

title: ‚öæ Why each MLB contender can win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: üî• Which CFB coaches are on the hot seat?
content: Who could be on the hot seat? Who are coaching candidates to watch? Our experts explain the current coaching landscape.

title: üèÄ Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clips partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Jags trade RB Bigsby to Eagles for draft picks
content: The Jaguars have traded running back Tank Bigsby to the Eagles for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: Regulations should foster technology innovations, not wipe them out, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The challenge not just in jobs, but also in a way in which these can be misused which can have repercussions for the society, the Union Finance Minister said

title: Supreme Court to pass order on September 23 in suo motu matter over environmental conditions in Himachal Pradesh
content: Observing the situation in the State had deteriorated, the Supreme Court had earlier said climate change was having a "visible and alarming impact" on the State

title: Justice M Sundar takes oath as Chief Justice of Manipur High Court
content: Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla administered the oath of office to Justice Sundar at a function in the Raj Bhavan

title: Supreme Court refuses to stay Waqf (Amendment) Act 2025 in its entirety
content: Supreme Court notes that ‚Äòpresumption always in favour of constitutionality of a statute.‚Äô It stays certain crucial Sections in the amendment law of 2025

title: Kerala Catholic Church mouthpiece hits back at RSS organ Kesari‚Äôs attack on Christians
content: Editorial in Deepika states that Kesari article ‚Äòlays bare the true colours‚Äô of Sangh Parivar and is ‚Äòpart of calculated conspiracy to undermine the Constitution by targeting Christians‚Äô

title: Former TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty appears before ED in betting app PMLA case
content: The statement of Ms. Chakraborty, 36, is being recorded under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) in a case related to an "illegal" betting app named 1xBet

title: Rain lashes Jharkhand; heavy rain alert issued for 16 districts
content: The IMD issued a yellow alert for East Singhbhum, West Singhbhum, Simdega, Seraikela-Kharswan, Deoghar, Dumka, Giridih, Jamtara and a few other districts

title: Pillar of Kalakshetra legacy Sarada Teacher passes away at 96
content: She was born on 15 June, 1929, in the Theosophical Society campus in Adyar; played an instrumental role in shaping and standardising the Kalakshetra methodology for Bharatanatyam

title: Hike to down shutters; Founder Kavin Mittal terms it difficult decision
content: The real money online gaming space was dealt a fatal blow after Parliament passed the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025

title: Supreme Court rejects plea to include women political workers under POSH Act
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai dismissed the petition saying it would open a Pandora‚Äôs box

title: Pulse Rewards loyalty programme launched for passengers at KIA Bengaluru
content: Throughout the year, Pulse Rewards will host special events and promotions, offering members unique experiences and additional opportunities to earn points

title: Karnataka High Court declines to interfere with government‚Äôs invitation to Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Mysuru Dasara this year
content: The petitioners questioned the State Government inviting a person who has no faith in worshipping Hindu gods to inaugurate the Dasara festival, which commences by worshipping a goddess as per Hindu rituals

title: Acharya Devvrat takes oath as Maharashtra Governor
content: Bombay High Court Chief Justice Shree Chandrashekhar administered the oath of office to Mr. Devvrat at the Raj Bhavan in Mumbai

title: Boy injured in landmine blast in J&K's Anantnag District dies
content: The boy was injured when a landmine, planted for the security of the ammunition depot at Khundru, went off

title: T.N. MLA Sengottaiyan reiterates call for AIADMK unity as ‚Äòdeadline‚Äô ends
content: On September 5, he set a 10-day deadline for the party leadership to take steps towards readmitting those who had left the AIADMK

title: Abducted truck driver rescued from ex-IAS probationer Puja Khedkar's house
content: Khedkar‚Äôs mother allegedly prevented the police from entering the house and got into a quarrel with them, the official said

title: Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil appears at Kerala Assembly, ends self-imposed political exile amid sexual misconduct charges
content: Rahul Mamkootathil occupies seat well away from Opposition and Treasury Benches allocated to him by Speaker A.N. Shamseer

title: First cargo parcel train from Kashmir valley to Delhi flagged off; L-G says service will boost local economy
content: The cargo parcel train was flagged off from Nowgam railway station here and is scheduled to reach Delhi on Tuesday (September 16, 2025)

title: Nuh‚Äôs madrasas weigh Haryana government‚Äôs modern education push
content: Chief Minister Nayab Saini has reaffirmed his government‚Äôs commitment to register madrasas and gurukuls with the Haryana State Education Board in order to integrate them into the mainstream and provide financial support; madrasas say they aren‚Äôt opposed to formal education but have concerns that need to be addressed

title: Farmer electrocuted in Belagavi district
content: Mallappa Sanju Shivapur, 23, was fixing an irrigation pump set in his field when he was hit by an electric shock

title: PM Modi inaugurates 16th armed forces‚Äô conference at Eastern Command HQ in Kolkata
content: The conference is the apex brainstorming forum of the armed forces, bringing together the nation‚Äôs top civil and military leadership to exchange views at the conceptual and strategic levels

title: Last date of ITR filing today; Income Tax Department says deadline not extended
content: The department urged taxpayers to rely only on updates from its verified handle @IncomeTaxIndia and not to be misled by unverified posts

title: Three Maoists carrying bounty of ‚Çπ1.35 crore killed in Hazaribagh
content: According to the police officials, the incident took place on September 14, 2025 when the troops of 209 CoBRA and police were conducting the search operation in the Pantitri forest

title: Mumbai drenched on first day of week; heavy rains affect morning commute
content: The heavy downpour, which began around midnight with lightning and thunder, continued in the morning, leading to inundation of low-lying areas like King's Circle and other areas

title: SC to continue Bihar SIR hearing today: LIVE
content: Previously, Supreme Court had directed the Election Commission of India to include Aadhaar as a valid proof for the Special Intensive Revision exercise of electoral rolls in poll-bound Bihar

title: Supreme Court partially stays Waqf (Amendment) Act 2025 | LIVE
content: SC stays provision that mandates a disputed property would not be treated as waqf unless the executive permits it after an enquiry

title: Indian Navy gets anti-submarine warfare ship
content: The name ‚ÄòAndroth‚Äô holds strategic and symbolic significance as it is derived from the Androth Island in the Lakshadweep archipelago, underscoring India‚Äôs commitment to safeguarding its vast maritime territories

title: Ilaiyaraaja accepts CM Stalin‚Äôs request to set Sangam literature to music
content: Music director A.R. Rahman, in a message, said Mr. Ilaiyaraaja had secured a special place for Tamil Nadu in the world of music. Mr. Rahman said Mr. Ilaiyaraaja‚Äôs Symphony would serve as an inspiration to any musician striving for excellence.

title: States should get compensation for GST revenue loss; eco growth should benefit all: Kerala FM
content: Kerala Finance Minister Balagopal emphasises passing on GST benefits to common people and warns of revenue loss impact on States

title: U.S. immigration authorities detain 73-year-old Sikh woman in California; family calls for her release
content: Harjit Kaur, who has lived in the East Bay in Northern California for more than 30 years, was detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials during a routine check-in earlier this week

title: West Bengal records highest child marriages in India at 6.3%, reveals data
content: Even after a decade of dedicated schemes targeting elimination of child marriage in West Bengal like Kanyashree Prakalpa the state records very high incidents of child marriage both in rural and urban areas

title: White-coats walk out in protest: Chhattisgarh‚Äôs health workers are on strike¬†¬†
content: For nearly a month, Chhattisgarh health workers have been on strike, demanding permanent employment and better working conditions. This has burdened the already strained healthcare system in the State

title: Defence Ministry unveils new framework to streamline revenue procurement
content: The new manual will ‚Äòfoster jointness among the three Services‚Äô and is aimed at achieving self-reliance  in defence sector, said the Defence Ministry

title: Public transport is the only way to tackle traffic congestion, says Hyderabad Metro Rail chief
content: Architects should leverage their technical expertise to develop innovative ideas to tackle population growth, environmental degradation, pollution control and fast-paced urbanisation, says HMR managing director at All India Architecture Reconnect Summit

title: Drive to curb multi-layered plastic waste in the Nilgiris launched
content: As the first step towards identifying the companies that have the biggest footprint in products sold and waste generated as a result, a brand and waste audit has been conducted in Coonoor. The exercise will be done in Udhagamandalam and Kotagiri, too

title: 'Taken to hospital 22km from crash site': Govt official killed by BMW
content: Navjot Singh, a deputy secretary, died in a road accident, prompting questions about the delay in medical assistance. His son, Navnoor, revealed the couple's accident near Dhaula Kuan after visiting Gurdwara Bangla Sahib. Concerns arose as they were taken to a distant hospital, Nulife Hospital, while closer options like AIIMS and Safdarjung were available.

title: 5-year Islam practice clause put on hold: SC imposes partial stay on Waqf Act; 3 key provisions stayed
content: The Supreme Court has partially stayed the Waqf Amendment Act 2025, specifically the provision requiring five years of Islamic practice to create a Waqf, pending rule formulation. While refusing a complete stay, the court emphasized the importance of having a Muslim CEO for Waqf Boards and restricted the creation of third-party rights on disputed properties.

title: Did BJP minister Jibesh Mishra assault journalist? Tejashwi presents video proof
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has strongly criticized PM Modi and CM Nitish Kumar, demanding action against Bihar minister Jibesh Mishra for allegedly assaulting a journalist who questioned road conditions. Yadav presented a video purportedly showing the incident and highlighted Mishra's alleged involvement in a fake drug case.

title: Handshake row escalates: Pakistan cry foul, lodge protest against India in Dubai
content: The India‚ÄìPakistan T20I ended in controversy after Suryakumar Yadav refused handshakes, citing solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack. Pakistan lodged a protest, alleging a breach of sportsmanship, while Salman Ali Agha skipped the presentation.

title: How Ukraine attacks on Russia refineries are benefiting India
content: Ukraine's drone attacks on Russian oil refineries created a crisis, which India has seized as an opportunity. Indian refiners are capitalizing on discounted Urals crude, boosting refining margins and exports, particularly diesel to Europe. Despite potential risks from fluctuating discounts and geopolitical pressures, India maintains its strategic autonomy in energy decisions.

title: Microsoft fires protesters: Prez calls them smart, says should have known better
content: Microsoft President Brad Smith defended the firing of employees who protested in his office against the company's ties to the Israeli military. He emphasized that their actions crossed the line into trespassing and property damage. Simultaneously, Microsoft is investigating allegations that its Azure cloud technology was misused for Palestinian surveillance, prompting scrutiny of tech companies' involvement in the conflict.

title: Web designer gets off car in Bengaluru to help injured dog, gets molested twice
content: In Bengaluru, a 29-year-old web designer was molested twice while aiding an injured stray dog. The accused, Manjunath, fled but was later traced by police. Witnesses chased him after the second assault, leading to his fall and injuries. Police are investigating the incident, and Manjunath's parents have assured his cooperation. The case was registered under relevant sections of the law.

title: 'Time for being soft is over': Trump reacts to Indian man beheading by 'illegal alien'
content: Donald Trump condemned the beheading of Chandra Nagamallaiah, allegedly by a Cuban "illegal alien" with a prior criminal record, in Dallas, Texas. Trump criticised the Biden administration's immigration policies, claiming the suspect should not have been in the country. He vowed to prosecute the killer to the fullest extent of the law and promised a tougher stance on illegal immigrant criminals if he were in power.

title: Apple iOS 26 release today: India release time; supported iPhone models and more
content: Apple is launching iOS 26 today, September 15th, at 10:30 PM IST, bringing a significant design overhaul and new features. The update introduces 'Liquid Glass,' Call Screening, Live Translation, and AutoMix. Compatible with iPhone 11 series and newer, iOS 26 enhances Messages, Apple Music, and CarPlay. Apple Intelligence features are exclusive to iPhone 15 Pro and later models.

title: Asia Cup: 'Popatwadi team' ‚Äî Gavaskar slams Pakistan after India humiliation
content: Sunil Gavaskar criticised Pakistan's performance in their Asia Cup loss to India, calling it unlike their proud cricketing legacy. India's spin trio dominated, restricting Pakistan to a low score, while Suryakumar Yadav led India's chase to a comfortable victory. Wasim Akram also lamented Pakistan's batsmen's struggles against Kuldeep Yadav's spin.

title: Heart attacks on rise: Not red meat or butter, these 5 everyday habits could be the cause
content: Increasing evidence suggests that modern foods and lifestyle patterns undermine nitric oxide production, crucial for cardiovascular health. Refined sugar, starches, industrial seed oils, smoking, and antibacterial mouthwash deplete nitric oxide, increasing the risk of heart disease. Conversely, leafy greens, beets, garlic, citrus fruits, nuts, and regular exercise can boost nitric oxide levels and support heart health.

title: Gemini Nano Banana AI Saree: What it this new trend; How can you create photos
content: Following the Nano Banana AI 3D figurine craze, the 'Banana AI Saree' trend has emerged on Instagram. Users are transforming selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits using Google‚Äôs Gemini Nano Banana image editing tool. The AI crafts images with chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, mimicking classic Bollywood aesthetics with popular styles like polka-dot and floral sarees.

title: Is Hardik Pandya dating model-actress Mahieka Sharma? Social media abuzz
content: Hardik Pandya is again in the spotlight, this time due to rumours linking him to model and actress Mahieka Sharma after his divorce from Natasa Stankovic and alleged split from Jasmin Walia. Online speculation arose from a Reddit thread highlighting a male figure in Mahieka's selfie and jersey number 33, associated with Hardik.

title: Family talks ahead: Conor McGregor exits Irish presidential race
content: Conor McGregor has withdrawn from the 2025 Irish presidential race, ending speculation about his political aspirations. Citing family considerations and the challenges of Ireland's electoral system, the UFC star announced his decision on X. McGregor acknowledged the public interest and hurdles in breaking through the party-dominated system, where nominations require support from parliament members or county councils.

title: Asia Cup: One down, two to go! How India and Pakistan could face each other again
content: The Asia Cup 2025 witnesses heightened tensions as India and Pakistan face off amidst political friction, marked by boycott calls and handshake controversies. India's dominant victory in their initial encounter sets the stage for potential further clashes in the Super Four and possibly the final, intensifying the politically charged atmosphere.

title: Who is Bob Vylan? British punk-rap duo mocks Charlie Kirk‚Äôs assassination
content: British punk-rap duo Bob Vylan ignited controversy after Bobby Vylan seemingly mocked Charlie Kirk's assassination during an Amsterdam performance, making gun gestures and sniper jokes. This followed earlier backlash for chanting "Death to the IDF" at Glastonbury, causing visa issues. The incidents have sparked debates about free speech, artistic expression, and the potential for inciting political violence through performance.

title: Kutch woman strangled by sons over suspicion of affair
content: In Nana Kadia village, a shocking incident unfolded as a 40-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her two sons, one a minor, due to suspicions of an extramarital affair. The brothers confessed to strangling her after confronting her about late-night phone calls and perceived neglect of household duties.

title: Her-yana heroes: Bhiwani erupts with joy over UK boxing glory
content: Haryana's women boxers, including Minakshi Hooda and Jaismine Lamboria, overcame societal taunts to achieve remarkable success at the World Boxing Championship in England. Minakshi secured gold, Jaismine also won gold, Nupur claimed silver, and Pooja earned bronze, sparking celebrations in Bhiwani, known as 'Mini Cuba' for its boxing legacy.

title: US, S Korea, Japan hold joint drills: North Korea slams ‚Äòreckless show of strength‚Äô
content: The United States, South Korea, and Japan have started a joint military exercise. It is off South Korea‚Äôs Jeju Island. The exercise is named Freedom Edge. It aims to boost cooperation against North Korea‚Äôs threats. North Korea has condemned the drills. Kim Yo Jong warned of bad results. Talks to curb North Korea‚Äôs weapons program are stalled.

title: 4 pilgrims dead as bus collides with truck on Lucknow-Varanasi Highway
content: A tragic accident on the Lucknow-Varanasi National Highway claimed the lives of four pilgrims and left nine others seriously injured. The bus, carrying 50 devotees from Ayodhya to Varanasi, collided with a truck near Sihipur village around 5 am. The collision occurred when the bus driver attempted to overtake the truck, resulting in extensive damage and casualties.

title: Top Maoist with Rs 1 crore bounty among 3 killed in Jharkhand encounter
content: In a significant blow to the CPI (Maoist), top leader Sahdeo Soren, carrying a Rs 1 crore reward, was killed in an encounter with security forces in Jharkhand. The operation also resulted in the deaths of two other Maoist commanders.

title: Hannah Einbinder‚Äôs Emmy win goes viral; Eagles fans hyped by ‚ÄòGo Birds‚Äô shoutout
content: Hannah Einbinder's Emmy win for *Hacks* became a viral sensation, blending Hollywood glamour with Philadelphia Eagles pride. She punctuated her acceptance speech with a spirited "Go Birds" shoutout, followed by bold political statements that were censored on live television. The moment resonated deeply with Eagles fans, turning the Dolby Theatre into a temporary extension of Lincoln Financial Field.

title: Solar eclipse: When is the ‚Äòsurya grahan‚Äô? Check timings and viewing tips
content: Get ready for a celestial treat. A partial solar eclipse will occur on September 21, 2025. The Moon will obscure a portion of the Sun. It will create a crescent shape. The eclipse coincides with the September equinox. It will be visible in Australia, New Zealand, and parts of the Pacific. Online streams will allow global viewing.

title: 'Don't want them to buy Russian oil': Trump asks Europe to 'toughen up'
content: Donald Trump is pressuring European allies to cease purchasing oil from Russia and strengthen their sanctions, deeming current measures insufficient. He has previously criticized China and India for similar actions, even imposing tariffs on India. While urging Nato to sanction China, Trump seems to be pursuing a separate agreement with India, omitting them from his recent criticisms.

title: Price prediction: Know the gold rate outlook for this week - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are closely watched as the US Federal Reserve is expected to cut rates this week. Prices previously hit all-time highs due to weak US economic data, geopolitical tensions, and rupee depreciation. The market anticipates a 25bps rate cut, with focus on Chair Powell's guidance amid economic slowdown and political pressure.

title: Trump vs Ivy League: Funding disputes, settlements, and battles explained
content: In President Trump‚Äôs second term, federal scrutiny of the Ivy League intensified, freezing billions in funding. Penn, Columbia, and Brown settled by revising policies and making payments, while Harvard is fighting in court over $2.2 billion in cuts. Cornell and Princeton remain undecided, with Dartmouth and Yale largely spared. The disputes highlight tensions between federal authority and university autonomy.

title: 'Red' alert in Mumbai, Thane, Raigad: Heavy rains lead to waterlogging
content: Mumbai, Thane, and Raigad faced a red alert as heavy overnight rains caused significant waterlogging, disrupting traffic and delaying local train services. King‚Äôs Circle and Matunga market were severely affected, with Colaba recording the highest rainfall at 88.2 mm.

title: Quake shakes Assam: Nurses act swiftly as tremors rock ward
content: During a 5.8-magnitude earthquake in Assam, nurses in Nagaon bravely protected newborns, earning praise for their quick thinking. The earthquake, with its epicenter in Udalguri, caused tremors across the Northeast and parts of West Bengal, prompting widespread panic. While no major damage or casualties were reported, authorities are closely monitoring the situation in the high seismic zone.

title: Passengers stranded mid-journey: Mumbai monorail comes to a halt in Wadala
content: A Mumbai monorail experienced a technical malfunction in Wadala, causing a halt and passenger transfer. Rajesh Ananda Bhojane, Ward Councillor, reported the incident, highlighting a supply issue cited by monorail officials. Bhojane urged government intervention to address the recurring problem. Fire Brigade officials arrived at the scene to start their operation.

title: 'If it‚Äôs about Pahalgam, then fight a war': Rashid Latif slams India‚Äôs handshake snub
content: The handshake row between India and Pakistan spiraled on Monday, with former captain Rashid Latif delivering a fiery outburst. Urging the Pakistan Cricket Board to lodge an official complaint, Latif accused India of ‚Äúbringing politics into cricket‚Äù after refusing handshakes in Dubai, while Shoaib Akhtar called on India to ‚Äúshow grace‚Äù despite praising their win.

title: Road rage twist: Truck helper kidnapped; rescued from ex-IAS Puja Khedkar‚Äôs Pune home
content: A road rage incident led to the kidnapping of a cement mixer's helper in Navi Mumbai after a minor collision. The SUV involved is registered to Puja Automobiles, linked to suspended IAS officer Puja Khedkar's Pune bungalow. The victim was rescued from the bungalow, but the SUV driver remains at large, and Khedkar's mother has been summoned for questioning.

title: Hera Pheri 3 shoot to start in Feb 2026: Paresh Rawal confirms return
content: Paresh Rawal's initial exit from 'Hera Pheri 3' due to disagreements sent shockwaves, leading to legal action from Akshay Kumar's production house. However, differences have been resolved, and Rawal is back, confirming filming will commence in early next year. Despite the turmoil, his bond with director Priyadarshan remains strong.

title: 77th Annual Emmy Awards 2025: Full and final list of winners
content: The 77th Primetime Emmy Awards at the Peacock Theater celebrated television's finest from June 2024 to May 2025, hosted by Nate Bargatze. Severance led nominations with 27 nods in the drama category, while Hacks aimed to defend its comedy series title. The event also spotlighted 35 first-time nominees, bringing fresh talent to the forefront.

title: Has the ITR filing deadline been pushed beyond Sept 15? What Income Tax dept said
content: The Income Tax Department refuted social media rumors of extending the ITR filing deadline beyond September 15, confirming it remains unchanged. Taxpayers are urged to rely solely on the department's verified handle for updates. Over six crore ITRs have been filed for the Assessment Year 2025-26.

title: Japan sets new record with 100k people over 100 yrs of age; 7 secrets to longevity
content: Japan has achieved a remarkable milestone with nearly 100,000 centenarians as of September 1, 2025, marking the 55th consecutive year of increase. Experts attribute this longevity to a balanced diet rich in fish and vegetables, strong social connections, and an active lifestyle. Good healthcare, preventive measures, and a clean environment also play crucial roles.

title: 'Covered with ants': Newborn girl buried alive in UP, saved after shepherd spots hand
content: In Shahjahanpur, a newborn girl was miraculously rescued after being found buried alive near the Bahgul river. A shepherd, hearing faint cries, discovered the infant beneath a mound of soil. Police are investigating the deliberate abandonment, reviewing CCTV footage to identify those responsible, while the baby receives critical care at the Govt Medical College due to injuries and weakness.

title: Holiday treats & oxygen: SpaceX launches Cygnus XL to ISS; 5 tons of supplies sent along
content: SpaceX launched Northrop Grumman's upgraded Cygnus XL on a Falcon 9, delivering over 5 tons of supplies to the ISS, including spare parts, research material, and holiday treats. The lengthened Cygnus XL, designed for increased cargo capacity, is set to be captured by the station's robotic arm on Wednesday.

title: 'Cricket ko political mat banao': Akhtar slams India; backs Salman Agha's protest
content: India's dominant victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 was overshadowed by a post-match controversy. The Indian team's apparent refusal to shake hands with the Pakistani players sparked outrage, with Shoaib Akhtar expressing his disappointment. This incident highlights the intense geopolitical tensions that continue to fuel the rivalry between the two nations, extending beyond the cricket field.

title: With car pickups & fake maps, land sharks net 'Jewar airport investors'
content: Land sharks are luring unsuspecting buyers with the promise of prime real estate near the upcoming Noida International Airport. These fraudulent schemes involve selling plots within YEIDA's notified area without authorization, using deceptive marketing tactics and fake documents. Authorities are cracking down on these illegal activities, urging the public to verify land ownership before investing to avoid being conned.

title: Justin Fields injury update: Jets QB forced out early; week 3 availability in doubt
content: New York Jets' quarterback Justin Fields suffered a concussion during the game against Buffalo Bills. He is now under medical observation. His availability for the next game against Tampa Bay Buccaneers is uncertain. Backup quarterback Tyrod Taylor stepped in after Fields' injury. Taylor completed 7 passes and scored a touchdown. The Jets are awaiting Fields' recovery.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex above 81,900
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Monday, While Nifty50 was above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 40 points.

title: Lighting up Kolkatas heritage through citizens' initiative
content: Kolkata Restorers, a citizen-led initiative, has illuminated 94 buildings in Kolkata since November 2023 through crowdfunding. Sparked by Mudar Patherya's effort to light Maniktala Market, the movement empowers residents to contribute to preserving their city's heritage. Prominent facades like Raj Bhavan and St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral now glow, showcasing Kolkata's architectural beauty.

title: Milad juloos winds through Hyderabad amid prayers and pageantry
content: Young men on two-wheelers, cars, lorries and even camels carried flags that signified the event; chants and slogans of prophethood were raised even as the procession moved towards the designated route

title: Protest turns violent in Manipur‚Äôs Churachandpur after police detain two for vandalising Modi cutouts
content: A mob protested near the Churachandpur police station against the detention of the two youths. Soon it turned into a clash between the mob and the security forces. The tension eased after the two were released

title: Sense of superiority based on birth should be continuously challenged, says new CPI State Secretary
content: M. Veerapandian argues that only the continuous inculcation of social science can bring about a meaningful change in society

title: Minority BJP government at Centre will not survive for long: Chief Minister Stalin
content: He says opposition parties have been claiming that the DMK has not fulfilled its poll promises as they are unable to accept that support for his government has been on the rise among the people

title: Residents call for change in ABC rules to curb stray dog menace
content: The council has come forward with a set of demands in the backdrop of the recent Supreme Court verdict allowing State governments to take appropriate action on the stray dog issue across the country

title: Over 3,000 cases settled in national Lok Adalat organised by DLSA in Malappuram
content: Two significant settlements were reached in cases involving loans from a nationalised bank in the district

title: Minister Anam Ramanarayana Reddy releases water from Somasila Reservoir to Penna River
content: The government is preparing plans to set up temple tourism parks across the district as per the orders of the Chief Minister

title: Half a century later, Short Service Officers still await pension justice
content: Emergency and Short Service Commissioned Officers, many now in their 70s and 80s, press on with a legal battle for benefits they say were promised in the 1960s

title: Karnataka: Mounting debts drive couple to kill children in Hosakote; man found dead, his wife rescued
content: Caught in a debt trap over the medical treatment of a man who became bedridden after a road accident four years ago, a couple killed their two minor children and decided to end their lives

title: Ahead of PM‚Äôs visit, Tejashwi Yadav makes surprise inspection of Purnia hospital
content: The leader of opposition in Bihar legislative Assembly pointed out that in the GMCH-Purnia, there is no ICU nor the cardiology department and even the trauma centre is not functional.

title: A.P. High Court Chief Justice stresses need to reduce gender discrimination
content: Despite progress over the years, gender discrimination and violence against women and girls have not been fully eradicated, says Justice Thakur

title: Amit Khare appointed Secretary to Vice-President C. P. Radhakrishnan¬†
content: Khare has been serving as Advisor to the Prime Minister since October 12, 2021, handling matters related to the social sector in the Prime Minister‚Äôs Office

title: Heavy rains, mudslides disrupt NH29; suspension bridge washed away in Nagaland
content: Landslides along the Mhainamtsii-Pimla road, an alternate route to Kohima, further disrupted vehicular movement

title: Women will shape vision of Viksit Bharat: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla
content: Conference in Tirupati stresses women‚Äôs literacy and reforms in legislatures; Andhra Speaker calls for ‚Äúno work, no pay‚Äù for MLAs

title: Internal reservation: Government in back-channel talks to convince nomadic tribes to withdraw protest¬†
content: The govt. is also mulling over a comprehensive special package for the microscopic communities, say sources

title: New CPI(M) committee office in Kannur to house historic ledger
content: The ledger, kept at the party district committee office Azhikodan Samaraka Mandiram, written by comrade Sreenivasan, who became the party office secretary in 1970, stands as a valuable testimony to the party‚Äôs legacy

title: Delhi govt. says free bus travel for transgender persons awaits Cabinet approval
content: HC disposes contempt plea but allows petitioner to revive case if proposal is rejected or delayed further

title: Kerala sees over 500 organ pledge registrations in four days
content: Two back-to-back heart transplant surgeries were carried out in Kochi, on September 11 and 13, as organs were harvested from brain-dead patients in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi

title: Secunderabad records 123 mm as heavy rains batter Hyderabad, trigger waterlogging and traffic chaos
content: Police personnel and HYDRAA teams were deployed across the twin cities to regulate traffic movement and clear waterlogging

title: Five arrested for selling painkiller tablets near Gudiyatham
content: Investigations revealed the gang was selling the tablets for youth and students in the area. Police seized the tablets, syringes and a two-wheeler from them

title: Crucial KPCC meeting to look into ‚ÄòMamkootathil controversy,‚Äô Wayanad organisational issues
content: Conclave takes place against the backdrop of ‚Äòfissures‚Äô within the Congress leadership over Mamkootathil‚Äôs suspension from the party. Party may launch revamp of digital media cell at the meet. It will look into developments in Wayanad following the suicide of DCC treasurer N.M. Vijayan

title: Government will not allow YSRCP implement its divisive agenda, asserts Andhra Pradesh Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: Accusing the opposition party of creating discord in society through its social media, he says the government will firmly deal with those vitiating peace

title: Probe finds Parassala SHO responsible for fatal hit-and-run
content: District Police Chief (Thiruvananthapuram Rural) has recommended the suspension of P. Anil Kumar who failed to adhere to proper procedure after the accident. The SHO did not stop to assist the injured person or report the incident immediately

title: India brags about having 1.4 billion people but won't buy one bushel of U.S. corn: Lutnick
content: The United States Commerce Secretary made these comments in an interview when asked whether the U.S. was mismanaging valuable relationships with allies like India, Canada and Brazil with tariffs imposed on these countries

title: ED summons former TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty and actor Urvashi Rautela in 1xBet case
content: The ED had earlier recorded the statements of former Indian cricketer Shikhar Dhawan and Suresh Raina in the same case

title: What We Know About Couple In BMW Which Rammed Finance Ministry Official
content: The couple in the BMW lives in Gurugram, police said, adding that they own a business of making horse leather saddles, seats, covers, and belts.

title: Who Is Harjit Kaur, 73-year-old Indian Grandmother Detained "Without Warning" in US
content: Amid US President Donald Trump's crackdown on immigration, Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old Indian origin grandmother, was detained by immigration authorities in California when she went for a routine check-in with the US agency.

title: BMW Driver Took Navjot Singh To Hospital 19 Km Away. Reason: Father Owns It
content: In a shocking development in the Delhi BMW crash case, police have found that the hospital where central government officer Navjot Singh was taken to after he was seriously injured in the accident was co-owned by the family of the accused

title: BMW Flipped Over, Victims Lying On Road: Videos Show Delhi Crash Horror
content: Navjot Singh, a senior finance ministry official, died, while his wife, Sandeep Kaur, sustained serious injuries after a BMW hit their bike on Sunday.

title: Indian Air Force Engineer Dies By Suicide, Jumps From 24th Floor In Bengaluru
content: Lokesh, an Indian Air Force engineer, jumped from the 24th floor of the Prestige Jindal City Apartments in Bengaluru.

title: "India Sells Everything To Us But Won't Buy Our Corn": Top US Official
content: India brags about having 1.4 billion people but won't buy even a small amount of American corn, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has said, asserting that New Delhi must bring down its tariffs or face a "tough time" doing business with the US.

title: 'Adani Cement FutureX' Programme Launched To Prepare Future Innovators
content: Adani Cement on Monday announced the launch of Adani Cement FutureX', a nationwide academiaindustry engagement programme designed to connect classrooms with real-world infrastructure and sustainability challenges.

title: 'No Regrets': Wounded Nepalis Protesters Proud At Change
content: University student Aditya Rawal was outside Nepal's parliament with hundreds of other anti-corruption protesters when gunfire crackled and 14 people slumped down in front of him.

title: UK Couple, Who Lived In Tent In Extreme Cold, Jailed Over Daughter's Death
content: A British woman from an aristocratic family and her convicted rapist partner face jail Monday over the manslaughter of their newborn daughter who died while they were living off-grid in freezing temperatures.

title: Massive Clashes In Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur, Durg Over Alleged Conversions
content: In Bilaspur, nearly 300 people had gathered for a meeting of the Christian community when Hindu organisations staged demonstrations outside, accusing the group of carrying out religious conversions.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink Reports Service Outage, Internet Down For Users
content: Elon Musk's satellite internet service Starlink is experiencing a service outage, according to a message on its website on Monday.

title: Income Tax Return DeadlineToday: Over 1 Crore Tax Filings Expected
content: As the extended deadline for income tax return (ITR) filing ends on Monday, filers are hurrying to comply, with more than 1 crore returns anticipated on the final day.

title: "Attempts To Harm Ties With India Will Fail": Russia Amid Trump's Tariffs
content: Russia has praised its longstanding "advancing" relations with India amid US President Donald Trump's tariffs on New Delhi over its Russian oil imports.

title: Mumbai Monorail Train Services Resume After Being Stuck For Hours
content: Monorail services were resumed after a nearly two-hour-long halt that occured on Monday morning due to technical glitches in Mumbai's Wadala area.

title: Heavy Rain In Mumbai, Local Trains Delayed, Traffic Chaos Amid Red Alert
content: Incessant rains and water-logging slowed down traffic in Mumbai on Monday morning, with the IMD issuing a 'red alert', predicting very heavy showers in the city and neighbouring areas over the next few hours.

title: Navjot Singh Was Taken To Hospital 19 km From BMW Crash Spot. Son Asks Why
content: On Sunday, Navjot Singh, Deputy Secretary in the Department of Economic Affairs under the Ministry of Finance, along with his wife, Sandeep Kaur, was returning home on his bike from Bangla Sahib Gurudwara when the couple met with an accident.

title: ITR Filing Last Date Today: What Happens If You Miss The Deadline
content: The deadline for most taxpayers, particularly salaried individuals, pensioners, and small businesses not requiring an audit, is Monday, September 15.

title: ITR Filing Deadline Extended? Income Tax Department Issues Clarification
content: If you have also come across a viral claim that the Income Tax Return (ITR) deadline has been extended until September 30, beware, it's fake.
